Class StreamUtils

    Helper functions for working with Streams.

        Put a single element at the beginning of a stream.
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

      • prepend

        public static <E> java.util.stream.Stream<E> prepend​(E elem,
                                                     java.util.stream.Stream<E> stream)
        Put a single element at the end of a stream.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of elements in the stream
        Parameters:
        stream - a stream
        elem - the element to be placed at the end
        Returns:
        a new stream that contains the elements of the exiting stream followed by the new elements

      • zip

        public static <A,​B> java.util.stream.Stream<Tuples.Two<A,​B>> zip​(java.util.stream.Stream<A> as,
                                                                             java.util.stream.Stream<B> bs)

        Take two streams and produces a new stream whose elements are pairs of the elements from the two streams. For example, if the streams are represented as [a1, a2, a3, ..., an] and [b1, b2, b3, ..., bn], then the resulting stream will be [(a1, b1), (a2, b2), ...]. The stream will be as long as the shorter of the two streams.

        Type Parameters:
        A - the type of the first value
        B - the type of the second value
        Parameters:
        as - the stream of A values
        bs - the stream of B values
        Returns:
        a stream of tuples of pairs of elements from each stream

      • integers

        public static java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.Integer> integers​(java.lang.Integer start)
        Generate an infinite stream of Integers, starting at a specified value.
        Parameters:
        start - the value to begin counting from (inclusive)
        Returns:
        an infinite stream of Integers counting up from the start value
